page.title: 05Memories of Riccall
page.content: There are now seven shops in Riccall compared with eight before the war. These included a slaughter house,and butchers,a cobblers,a sweet shop and a bicycle shop.Now they are mainly food shop.The post office was in a shop which now sells groceries and green groceries. The Church Hall was used as a school until 1931 for children up to the age of 14. When the present school was built children were transfered and it is now a Primary School. The doctor's surgeries were held in private houses but in 1983 a health centre was built. Until 1961 the population was about 750 but 4 new estates have been built and the population is now about 1900.
